heisigStory: Soil and a scorpion (an "earth animal"). This is, of course, the full character from which the primitive for ground derives.
hint: Picture the ground as an extent of soil where scorpions are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying ´no trespassing, scorpion mines´ if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there.
koohiiStory1: Picture the ground as an extent of soil where scorpions are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying ´no trespassing, scorpion mines´ if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there.
koohiiStory2: The soil is littered with scorpions everywhere and no ones dares put their foot on the ground.
readingExamples: 地下 (ちか), 天地 (てんち), 境地 (きょうち)
